_description: Descriptions for elements missing from XSD documentation
_source: Derived from MSI SDK documentation and WiX schema specifications

patches.name: UpgradeVersion
patches.description: Specifies a range of product versions to detect for upgrade processing. Used within the Upgrade element to find installed products matching the UpgradeCode.

patches.name: Show
patches.description: Controls the visibility of a dialog control based on a condition. When the condition evaluates to true, the control is shown or hidden accordingly.

patches.name: InstallUISequence
patches.description: Defines the sequence of actions to execute during the user interface phase of installation. Contains Custom, Show, and standard action elements.

patches.name: InstallExecuteSequence
patches.description: Defines the sequence of actions to execute during the execution phase of installation. Contains Custom and standard action elements that run with elevated privileges.

patches.name: AdminUISequence
patches.description: Defines the sequence of actions to execute during the user interface phase of administrative installation (creating a network image).

patches.name: AdminExecuteSequence
patches.description: Defines the sequence of actions to execute during the execution phase of administrative installation (creating a network image).

patches.name: AdvertiseExecuteSequence
patches.description: Defines the sequence of actions to execute during feature advertisement. Advertisement registers shortcuts and file associations without installing files.

patches.name: EmbeddedChainer
patches.description: Defines an embedded chainer that runs after the MSI installation completes. Used for installing multiple packages in sequence from a single installer.

patches.name: EmbeddedUI
patches.description: Embeds a custom external UI handler DLL in the MSI package. The embedded UI replaces the standard Windows Installer dialogs with a custom user interface.

patches.name: Error
patches.description: Defines a localized error message that can be displayed during installation. Maps an error number to message text for the Error table.

patches.name: Publish
patches.description: Publishes a ControlEvent when a dialog control is activated. Used to define button actions like navigating to another dialog or setting property values.

patches.name: ProgressText
patches.description: Specifies the text displayed in the progress dialog during a specific action. Provides user feedback about what step is currently executing.

patches.name: TextStyle
patches.description: Defines a reusable text style for installer dialogs. Specifies font name, size, color, and attributes like bold or italic for UI text rendering.

patches.name: MessageQueuePermission
patches.description: Grants permissions on a message queue to a user or group. Used with the MSMQ extension to configure queue access rights during installation.
